35232142: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon visits Newton Stewart to assess flood damage as businesses and residents call for more preventative measures and improved flood defenses.
40143035: Two tour buses were deliberately set on fire outside a hotel in Northern Ireland, destroying passengers' belongings and delaying their trips.
35951548: Lewis Hamilton beat Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg to pole position at the Bahrain Grand Prix, with Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen close behind.
36266422: John Bates, a former scout leader, faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, accused of committing offenses between 1972 and 1989, which he denies.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at Cerahpasa hospital in Istanbul threatened to shoot himself and others, leading to the evacuation of patients and staff.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors secured a bonus-point victory against the Dragons in a hard-fought match, with tries from Chris Fusaro, Zander Fagerson, Junior Bulumakau, and Simone Favaro.
20836172: A woman was killed and a man injured when a car struck them at a bus stop in Streatham High Road, with police seeking Nathan Davis in connection to the incident.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie died after a collision with a motorbike during the Gent-Wevelgem race, prompting discussions on improving safety measures in the sport.
40758845: Manchester City midfielder Ilkay Gundogan says he is close to returning from a knee injury but will not rush his comeback, as he targets a Premier League title challenge this season.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to hospital with a head injury and suspected multiple fractures after a crash at the junction of the A127 and Progress Road in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex.
34615665: Tropical storm Patricia, the strongest to hit mainland Mexico since 1959, raises questions about how storm categories are determined and their meanings.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks discovered that weaknesses in the way wireless mice communicate with computers left them vulnerable to attacks, allowing hackers to take control of PCs.
37922330: 38 staff members at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell have been made redundant due to adverse trading conditions, but some may find employment with a Melrose-based company.
30844962: The European Commission has expressed doubts about Amazon's tax arrangement with Luxembourg, suspecting it may have broken EU rules by granting the company a competitive advantage.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a three-day extravaganza celebrating farming, food, and family fun, attracts over 90,000 visitors and showcases local produce, livestock, and family entertainment.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google for breaches of the Data Protection Act and misusing private information, seeking to block photos of him at a sex party that were first printed in the now-defunct News of the World.
38900884: Dragons flanker, Eddie Jackson, will miss the rest of the season due to injury, providing an opportunity for other players to step up in the Pro12.
13890581: The UK government announces a three-year funding package for the Cornish Language Partnership to ensure the survival of the Cornish language, which is classified as "critically endangered" by the United Nations.
40194700: Monaco's head coach Leonardo Jardim signs a new contract with the French champions after leading them to the Ligue 1 title and the Champions League semi-finals in 2016-17.
37903647: The US State Department has criticized the re-election of Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega, saying the election process was flawed and could not be seen as free and fair.
13291223: South Africa's government announces a task force to address "corrective rape" targeting lesbians, following the killing and rape of activist Noxolo Nogwaza and a petition signed by 170,000 people.
36052570: Big oil producers meet in Qatar to discuss a production freeze, but skepticism remains over its impact on oversupply; US stocks fall amid weak economic data and energy sector concerns.
34944735: US biologists have discovered that tarantulas evolved bright blue coloration independently at least eight times, likely not driven by sexual selection but potentially for concealment or warning purposes.
32159602: Germanwings co-pilot Andreas Lubitz, who is believed to have intentionally crashed Flight 9525, had researched suicide methods and cockpit door security in the week before the crash, prosecutors say.
34988915: Radio presenter Neil Fox denies allegations of sexual assault, claiming any "horseplay" with colleagues was consensual.
37889203: Tottenham midfielder Dele Alli will miss England's upcoming friendlies against Germany and Brazil due to a knee injury sustained during training.
33609927: Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with child abuse in-house and requiring two witnesses to a crime has led to decades-long delays in bringing abusers to justice.
33578778: Former Greek Finance Minister Yanis Varoufakis says the Greek bailout plan will "go down in history as the greatest disaster of macroeconomic management ever."
36888270: The International Paralympic Committee is considering banning Russia from the Rio Paralympics after a report claimed the country operated a widespread doping program from 2011 to 2015.
36846007: London Irish sign 24-year-old former England under-20 international Ben Franks from north London side, adding Championship experience to their roster.
31723471: Manor Marussia F1 team secures investment from Ovo boss Stephen Fitzpatrick and appoints former Sainsbury's CEO Justin King as interim chairman, ensuring their participation in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government and Liberal Democrats agreed on a £39m stimulus package to boost the economy, including funding for apprenticeships, school upgrades, and housing.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister John Major warns that Brexit will be a "historic mistake" and that the UK will be a diminished diplomatic force in the world after leaving the EU.
20936833: The House of Commons is debating a bill to cap benefit rises at 1% for three years, which the coalition argues is necessary to reduce the deficit, but Labour opposes, saying it will result in a real-terms cut in support for millions of working people.
36832879: A collapsed sewer under train tracks in Forest Hill has caused major disruption to Southern, Thameslink and London Overground services, with repairs expected to last until Wednesday.
14958201: Substitute Mario Balotelli scored the breakthrough goal and James Milner added another as Manchester City defeated Everton 2-0 to move top of the Premier League.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon faces criticism for claiming a target to reduce six-week delays in discharging patients had been delivered, with Labour stating it had not been met for over three years.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that overflow pipes at the Burry Inlet near Llanelli, used to prevent flooding, breached clean water laws in a special conservation area.
34303109: Pope Francis arrives in Cuba and hails improving ties between the US and Cuba as "an example of reconciliation for the whole world" before his four-day visit.
39939090: Former England playmaker Rangi Chase joins bottom-of-the-table Widnes Vikings after being told he did not feature in Castleford Tigers' plans for the rest of 2017.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive Roddy Smith is stepping down after 10 years, during which he oversaw a quadrupling of turnover and a rise in participation figures.
36783415: Sunderland urges the FA to quickly resolve the speculation surrounding Sam Allardyce's potential appointment as England manager, as they want him to remain with the club.
37935687: Wales narrowly defeated Argentina 24-20 in a hard-fought match, with tries from Liam Williams and Gareth Davies, and Leigh Halfpenny's late penalty ultimately making the difference.
40260829: The Bulford Kiwi monument in the UK, carved by New Zealand troops during WWI, has been granted protection by the Department for Culture, Media and Sport on the advice of Historic England.
36478199: An inmate at HMP Wayland seized an officer's keys and ran down a landing before being restrained, with both him and another prisoner involved being transferred to a higher security jail.
34541803: Former Premier League player Chris Sutton defends Tim Sherwood's managerial abilities and urges Aston Villa to give him more time to improve the team's performance.
35360841: The Welsh government plans to overhaul the Blue Badge disabled parking scheme to tackle fraud and streamline the system, following complaints of genuine cases being rejected.
35550407: Life expectancy for 65-year-olds in England reaches its highest level in 2014, but concerns remain about regional disparities and the number of elderly people living in poor health.
37561590: Nottinghamshire Police's Operation Equinox is investigating 636 reports of historical child sex abuse, with 530 crimes occurring on council property and 485 committed by council staff.
39328843: The quarter-final draw for the Women's FA Cup has resulted in all-top-flight matches, with Chelsea facing Sunderland, Manchester City traveling to Bristol City, Liverpool hosting Notts County, and Birmingham City playing Arsenal.
35389665: Cheltenham Town secured their seventh win in eight National League games with a 4-1 victory over Bromley, maintaining second place in the table.
33080187: Jean Charles de Menezes, a Brazilian electrician, was fatally shot by police at Stockwell Tube station in 2005 after being mistaken for a suicide bomber.
38636995: Glasgow City Council plans to raise council tax by 3% to support frontline services and avoid cuts, generating over £7m, though facing a £67m budget gap.
18536236: Sustainable Shetland seeks judicial review of Scottish government's approval of Viking Energy's wind farm, citing concerns over size and landscape impact, despite potential economic benefits.
36289151: Ugandan opposition leader Kizza Besigye has been charged with treason after insisting he was the rightful winner of the recent general election, which saw President Yoweri Museveni extend his 30-year rule.
23017045: Wales wing George North scored a stunning solo try as the British and Irish Lions won the first Test against Australia 23-21 in Brisbane.
36418082: Germany's Marco Reus and Sebastian Rudy have been left out of the Euro 2016 squad due to injury concerns, while Bastian Schweinsteiger has been included despite recent knee issues.
34396551: FIFA president Sepp Blatter is accused of making a "disloyal payment" of $2m to Michel Platini, who denies wrongdoing and plans to run for FIFA president once Blatter steps down.
39720944: John Higgins reaches the World Snooker Championship semi-final for the first time since 2011 with a 13-6 win over Kyren Wilson.
35884842: Private Paul Wilkinson testified at the inquest into the death of Private Cheryl James, who was found dead with a bullet wound to her head at Deepcut barracks in 1995.
35403375: Entrepreneur Doug Richard allegedly paid for a 13-year-old girl and her 15-year-old friend to travel from Norwich, had sex with the younger girl, and is now on trial for sexual activity with a minor and paying a child for sex.
26341324: Vandalism of 11 cables in Ealing disrupts BT, Plusnet, and Talk Talk services in London and South East, with engineers working to resolve the issue.
19212345: South African runner Caster Semenya qualifies fastest for the Olympic 800m final, with her coach Maria Mutola predicting a competitive race against rivals from Kenya and Russia.
30548367: SXSW organizers face lawsuits alleging serious safety lapses after a car crash killed four people and injured 23 during the festival, with claims of insufficient traffic safeguards for pedestrians.
37919402: British sailors Hannah Mills and Saskia Clark won the prestigious female World Sailor of the Year award after securing Olympic gold in the women's 470 event at Rio 2016.
39995133: British fencer Richard Kruse won his first World Cup title in Shanghai, just days after being attacked upon arrival in the city.
40249088: Ineos plans to expand its ethylene production capacity at Grangemouth and Rafnes plants, and build a new propylene production unit, creating 150 new jobs at each location.
40254388: Uber's board has adopted a series of recommendations following a review by the former US Attorney-General Eric Holder into the company's culture and practices.
31995230: English Heritage approves replacement of 16th Century Charminster bridge with a new one featuring larger arches to improve River Cerne's flow and prevent nearby church flooding.
38632129: Chelsea strengthens their title position with a 3-0 win against Leicester City, while Tottenham, Liverpool, Arsenal, Manchester City, and Manchester United fight for top spots.
35720795: 22-year-old Glasgow midfielder disqualified for 12 months and fined £500 after providing an alcohol reading of 78mg, exceeding the legal limit of 22mg, during a breath test.
